name: Victoria
hint: Africa's largest lake and the world's second-largest freshwater lake, shared by Tanzania, Uganda, and Kenya

name: Tanganyika
hint: The world's second-deepest and second-largest freshwater lake by volume, in the Great Rift Valley

name: Malawi
hint: Africa's third-largest lake, also known as Lake Nyasa, famous for its extraordinary fish biodiversity

name: Turkana
hint: The world's largest permanent desert lake, in the Great Rift Valley of Kenya, formerly called Lake Rudolf

name: Chad
hint: A historically large but shrinking lake at the junction of four countries in the Sahel region of Africa

name: Albert
hint: One of the African Great Lakes, on the border of Uganda and the Democratic Republic of the Congo

name: Kivu
hint: One of the African Great Lakes on the border of DRC and Rwanda, known for dissolved gases in its depths

name: Tana
hint: Ethiopia's largest lake and the source of the Blue Nile, located in the northwestern highlands
